rooms.Name: The seashore south of Mysidia
rooms.Description:
Here, next to the Mysidian sea, a robust sea breeze blows your hair about and
gives you a slight chill. The sea lies to your south, and the smooth shoreline
continues east and west of here. Further east, you can see that the shorline
eventually dips south, forming the famous Mysidian bay - the subject of many
legends. A small, weathered path leads north, where it eventually enters
Mysidia itself. It is also possible to travel east along the shoreline,
however there is no road leading in this direction. The soil here is moist
from its proximity to the sea, and the smell of the ocean is ever-present.

Exits.Description:
Looking north, you can see the small village of Mysidia, world-renowned town of
mages. The dirt path leading there is well travelled, and wagon tracks are
visible in the wet soil.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The Mysidian Bay is the subject of many fanciful wives' tales as well as many
legends which may be valid. Most of these stories include waves and currents
of epic proportions. Right now, however the bay seems quite placid.
The ground here is cold and damp, and some sparse grass grows here.

Looking north, you can see the small village of Mysidia, world-renowned town of
mages. The dirt path leading there is well travelled, and wagon tracks are
visible in the wet soil.
The sand on the beach is soft, but very cold.

rooms.Name: Mysidia, village of mages
rooms.Description:
Mysidia is a very rural village. The small town is surrounded by trees, and
most of the buildings are built right on the grass. The buildings are all made
of some sort of white stone, made into bricks. Right now, you stand in some
sort of village square. One of the few places with pavement in this village,
the square is actually a circle of road convieniently located between all the
buildings. Mages and wizards hustle about here, running errands or simply
enjoying a walk. The air here is clean and fresh, probably something enspelled
by the mages here. The circle turns into a single paved path leading north up
some steps to a very large building. The large building is easily the most
prominent building in the whole village. South of here, a small path leads out
of the town down to the seashore. Other exits lead to various other parts of
the city, including shops, an inn and cafe, and the famous Serpent Road.

Exits.Description:
To the north, and up a small flight of steps is a rather impressive building.
It is the largest and probably most important building in Mysidia.
To the east you see Mysidia's inn and cafe, and also the general store.

A short dirt trail leads out of the village to the south. You hear the sound of
gulls from this direction.
To the west is Mysidia's equipment shop and also the training room.

Northeast of here lies Mysidia's end of the Serpent Road - the mysterious
underwater route from here to the nation of Baron.
There is a small pond to the northwest behind the equipment shops.

ExtraDescs.Description:
To the north, and up a small flight of steps is a rather impressive building.
It is the largest and probably most important building in Mysidia.

The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.
There is a small pond to the northwest behind the equipment shops.

Northeast of here lies Mysidia's end of the Serpent Road - the mysterious
underwater route from here to the nation of Baron.
The grass is cut all to the same length, and looks a lush green.
The trees are green with life, and are kept neatly trimmed.
To the west is Mysidia's equipment shop and also the training room.

A short dirt trail leads out of the village to the south. You hear the sound of
gulls from this direction.
To the east you see Mysidia's inn and cafe, and also the general store.

Mysidia is a beautiful village; everywhere you look it seems clean and
flourishing.

rooms.Name: Outside Mysidia's equipment shops
rooms.Description:
You stand in the grassy area in the southwestern area of Mysidia. To the north
is a large building with two doors facing you. Above the northwestern door is
a huge wooden sign with a large sword carved on it. A similar sign, this one
with a shield on it is above the northeastern door. To the west is a two-story
building with no markings on it. The town square lies to the east of here.

Exits.Description:
To the east lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas in
town.
The two-story building to the west appears to be some sort of training hall.

The sign with the large shield obviously signifies that the door beneath it
leads to the armor shop.

The sign with the large sword obviously signifies that the door beneath it
leads to the weapon shop.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Mysidia is a beautiful village; everywhere you look it seems clean and
flourishing.
The grass is cut all to the same length, and looks a lush green.
The trees are green with life, and are kept neatly trimmed.

The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.

To the east lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas in
town.

The signs are nearly as big as the doors, and have been carved out of some kind
of hardwood.
The two-story building to the west appears to be some sort of training hall.

The sign with the large shield obviously signifies that the door beneath it
leads to the armor shop.

The sign with the large sword obviously signifies that the door beneath it
leads to the weapon shop.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: Weapon shop in Mysidia
rooms.Description:
The weapon shop is a small building with a counter at the north end, behind
which the shopkeeper can sit and sell his wares. There are various signs
adorning the walls, and there is a carpet at the entrance, presumably to wipe
your feet. The exit back outside lies southeast.

Exits.Description: The exit back outside is to the southeast.

ExtraDescs.Description: The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
The carpet is navy blue, with white floral designs woven into it.
The signs all indicate that this is definitely the weapon shop.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: Armor shop in Mysidia
rooms.Description:
The armor shop is small, but still comfortable. There is a counter at the north
end for the shopkeeper to utilize to sell his wares, as well as a table and
chairs in the corner of the room for tired customers. The exit back outside
lies southwest.

Exits.Description: The exit back outside is to the southwest.

ExtraDescs.Description: The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.

The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style so
that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: Mysidia's training room
rooms.Description:
The training room meets the standard requirements for a place of learning set
long ago. Most training rooms the world over look identical on the inside.
This floor is set up in a lecture hall format; the teacher stands behind a
long desk instructing the students, who each have a small desk of their own.
There are various chairs and tables here, as well as some desks which are
still free. The floor is carpeted in some places, where students can sit and
read books from the shelves which adorn the room. In the back of the room
there is a stairway leading up, and to the east is the doorway back outside.

Exits.Description: To the east is the exit from the training room to the outdoors.
Stairs lead up to the second floor of the training room.

ExtraDescs.Description: The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.

The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style so
that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
The carpet is navy blue, with white floral designs woven into it.

The books on the shelves are all to big and the words in them are all too
small. You decide it's not worth reading any of them.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.
Stairs lead up to the second floor of the training room.

rooms.Name: The upper floor of Mysidia's training room
rooms.Description:
The training room meets the standard requirements for a place of learning set
long ago. Most training rooms the world over look identical on the inside.
This floor is set up similar to the floor below. The teacher stands behind an
L-shaped desk in the north end of the room, instructing the class. The
students all have small desks of their own; some are still empty. There are
various chairs and tables here, but unlike downstairs, there are no carpets or
shelves. In the back of the room there is a stairway leading down.

Exits.Description: Stairs lead down to the first floor of the training room.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style so
that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
Stairs lead down to the first floor of the training room.

rooms.Name: Outside Mysidia's inn
rooms.Description:
The southeastern area of the town contains two buildings. Mysidia's inn is a
few feet north of here, and to the east lies the local general store. The sign
on the inn indicates that one of its two floors also contains a cafe, where
locals meet and have a bite to eat. The town square lies to the west of here.

Exits.Description: The building to the north houses Mysidia's inn and cafe.
The sign above the eastern door indicates that it is Mysidia's general store.

To the west lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas in
town.

ExtraDescs.Description: The trees are green with life, and are kept neatly trimmed.
The grass is cut all to the same length, and looks a lush green.

To the west lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas in
town.
The building to the north houses Mysidia's inn and cafe.
The sign above the eastern door indicates that it is Mysidia's general store.

The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.

Mysidia is a beautiful village; everywhere you look it seems clean and
flourishing.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: Mysidia's cafe
rooms.Description:
The pleasant smell of herbal drinks permeates the environment here, and the
sound of peoples' conversations all mixed together gives the room a friendly
air. There is a bar here serving drinks, as well as tables surrounded by
chairs to relax and have a drink or a bite to eat. Near the bar there is a
sign on the wall. There is a stairway near the exit outdoors which leads up.
The exit back outside leads south.

Exits.Description: The exit from the cafe is to the south.
The stairway leads up to Mysidia's local inn.

ExtraDescs.Description: It doesn't look like anything you would like.
The stairway leads up to Mysidia's local inn.

The furniture is moderately clean, although here and there is a spill which
hasn't been cleaned up yet.

The sign says: Neither forgive, nor forget the Baronian pillage and
destruction!
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: Mysidia's inn
rooms.Description:
This simple room contains a small desk for the innkeeper, and farther west, six
beds. You can hear the buzz of conversation from the cafe, which is down a
short flight of stairs.

Exits.Description: Mysidia's cafe is downstairs.

ExtraDescs.Description: It's just a small desk for the inkeeper.
The beds look very clean and comfortable.
Mysidia's cafe is downstairs.
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.

rooms.Name: General store in Mysidia
rooms.Description:
The general store is a small building, with a counter at the north end, closing
in the shopkeeper, who stands behind it, selling a multitude of items. The
rest of the store is quite cluttered with shelves and chairs, making it a
little hard to walk around in here. The exit back outside lies to the west.

Exits.Description: The exit back outside is to the west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style so
that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: A small pond in Mysidia
rooms.Description:
A beautiful cascade of fresh clear water pours out of a large hole in a wall to
the north here into a small pond of clear water. There is a lot less activity
here than the rest of the town, and it is a very pleasant surroundings. The
grass and trees here are even more beautiful than the rest of the city, and
the air is almost sweet-smelling. The town square lies to the southeast of
here.

Exits.Description:
To the southeast lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other
areas in town.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.
The trees are green with life, and are kept neatly trimmed.
The grass is cut all to the same length, and looks a lush green.

Mysidia is a beautiful village; everywhere you look it seems clean and
flourishing.

To the southeast lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other
areas in town.

The clear water pours through long but not high hole in the wall about 10 feet
off the ground, presumably from some source behind the wall.

rooms.Name: Outside the Serpent Road of Mysidia
rooms.Description:
This part of Mysidia contains the building wherein lies Mysidia's end of the
famous Serpent Road. The other end lies in the nation of Baron, miles across
the sea to the northwest. Little is known about the mysterious road, save that
it is said to drain the stamina of the traveller. The passage takes only a few
seconds. The building containing the road is just north of here. The town
square lies to the southwest of here.

Exits.Description:
From the outside, the building in which the Serpent Road begins looks just like
any other.

To the west lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas in
town.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Mysidia is a beautiful village; everywhere you look it seems clean and
flourishing.
The grass is cut all to the same length, and looks a lush green.
The trees are green with life, and are kept neatly trimmed.

The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.

To the west lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas in
town.

From the outside, the building in which the Serpent Road begins looks just like
any other.

Interestingly enough, THIS door doesn't look like a door. This strikes you as
odd - I mean, all the rest of them did.

rooms.Name: The Serpent Road of Mysidia
rooms.Description:
The inside of the Serpent Road building is relatively unremarkable; there is
no furniture, and the walls are bare. There is a walled off area in the back
of the room which houses the entrance to the Serpent Road. It is a shimmering
circular pearl disk embedded into the floor. It seems to draw you towards it,
as if to pull you inside...

Exits.Description: The door back outside is to the south.

The entrance to the Serpent Road has about a five foot diameter, and it is
impossible to tell how deep into the floor it is. It gives off its own pale
prismic light.

ExtraDescs.Description: The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.

Remarkably, it looks just like the other side of an interestingly undoor-like
door.

The entrance to the Serpent Road has about a five foot diameter, and it is
impossible to tell how deep into the floor it is. It gives off its own pale
prismic light.
There isn't any.  Told you so.

rooms.Name: Outside the House of Wishes
rooms.Description:
The House of Wishes is made from the same white stone as most of the
buildings in Mysidia. The impressive building sits on top of what was once a
hill, but now has been turned into a small plateau by the use of a
surrounding wall. Steps lead through a break in the wall to the south, where
they eventually become a paved road, leading to the town square of Mysidia.
Pools of sparkling clear water pour through the wall to other parts of the
village, filling the air with the beautiful sound of rushing water. A single
door to the north leads into the magnificent House of Wishes.

Exits.Description: The House of Wishes is still there.

To the south lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas
in town.

ExtraDescs.Description: Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

To the south lies the town square, from whence you can get to all other areas
in town.
A wall surrounds the plateau which the House of Wishes is built upon.
There aren't any trees near the House of Wishes.
The grass is cut all to the same length, and looks a lush green.

The House of Wishes is made of a very clean white stone which has been cut
into bricks.

Mysidia is a beautiful village; everywhere you look it seems clean and
flourishing.

rooms.Name: The House of Wishes
rooms.Description:
This is the entrance hall to the House of Wishes. An impressive blue carpet
spans the length of floor between the door south and a stairway which leads
north. The furnishings in the entrance are rather sparse, just a desk or two
and a few torches shining off the white stone walls, the same white stone of
which most of the buildings in Mysidia are made.

Exits.Description: A mysterious glow emanates from the top of the stairs.
The exit back outside is to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description: The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
The carpet is navy blue, with white floral designs woven into it.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

Upon closer examination of a torch, you notice a small label attached to it.
It reads: R-66Y series fusion-powered torch - DO NOT REMOVE.

The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style
so that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
A mysterious glow emanates from the top of the stairs.

rooms.Name: The Crystal Room of Mysidia
rooms.Description:
The famous Crystal Room of Mysidia is unlike any other part of the antiquated
House of Wishes. The floors are made of a strange, clear glassy substance
which despite its fragile look, cannot be broken or scratched. The walls here
are made of some kind of reflective metal, which reflects the Crystal's glow.
By far the most distinguishing feature though is the shaft in the center of
the room wherein floats the Crystal of Mysidia. The crystal hangs motionless
in midair in the center of the shaft. Four tall pillars surround the shaft,
and presumably support the crystalline celing of the chamber. A stairway
leads down to the south, and the north wall of the chamber has a single door
in it.

Exits.Description: If you've guessed correctly, this door should lead to the Tower of Wishes.
The southern stairway leads to the main area of the House of Wishes.

ExtraDescs.Description: The southern stairway leads to the main area of the House of Wishes.

Remarkably, it looks just like a door. (Well, it's close enough to fool YOU
anyway.)

The four pillars are very tall, and seem to be made out of the same material
as the walls are.

The celing is quite high, and from down here appears to be made of a
quartz-like crystal.

Any metallurgist, with only a quick scan of the walls, that they appear to be
made of platinum. However, after a more thorough examination, it becomes
obvious that this is not the case.

The strange clear material is cut into cubes, and some mysterious force holds
them together. Below them you see only darkness...

The Crystal hangs ominously in the air in the center of the shaft, emitting a
faint light which is caught and reflected by the strange walls, floor, and
celing here, creating a magnificent effect.

rooms.Name: The Tower of Wishes
rooms.Description:
The bottom of the famous Tower of Wishes is actually not very impressive,
consisting of a hard stone floor and brick walls.  A door leads south out of
here, and a stairway leads up, presumably to the summit of the tower.

Exits.Description: A sign over the south door reads, "Crystal Room".  I wonder where it goes?
The stairs lead up to the top of the Tower of Wishes.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.

Remarkably, it looks just like a door. (Well, it's close enough to fool YOU
anyway.)
The stairs lead up to the top of the Tower of Wishes.
The floor is made of a smooth dark gray stone.

rooms.Name: The top of the Tower of Wishes
rooms.Description:
The summit of the Tower of Wishes is incredibly beautiful. A large part of
the southern wall is open, and to the south is a lovely view of not only the
entire village of mages, but also the breathtaking Mysidian Bay. The last
wisps of the breeze off the ocean arrive here; feelings of deep spirituality
well up within you.

Exits.Description: The stairway leads down to the bottom of the Tower of Wishes.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into
bricks.
The stairway leads down to the bottom of the Tower of Wishes.
The view from up here completely takes your breath away.  Wow.
You can't actually SEE the comfortable breeze.
The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.
The buildings are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.

rooms.Name: The Serpent Road of Baron
rooms.Description:
The inside of the Serpent Road building is relatively unremarkable; there is
no furniture, and the walls are bare. There is a walled off area in the back
of the room which houses the entrance to the Serpent Road. It is a shimmering
circular pearl disk embedded into the floor. It seems to draw you towards it,
as if to pull you inside...

Exits.Description:
The entrance to the Serpent Road has about a five foot diameter, and it is
impossible to tell how deep into the floor it is. It gives off its own pale
prismic light.
The door back outside is to the southeast.

ExtraDescs.Description: Remarkably, it looks just like a door.
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.

The entrance to the Serpent Road has about a five foot diameter, and it is
impossible to tell how deep into the floor it is. It gives off its own pale
prismic light.
There isn't any.  Told you so.

rooms.Name: General store in Baron
By the old water-way in Baron
Baron's training room
rooms.Description:
The training room meets the standard requirements for a place of learning set
long ago. Most training rooms the world over look identical on the inside.
This floor is set up in a lecture hall format; the teacher stands behind a
long desk instructing the students, who each have a small desk of their own.
There are various chairs and tables here, as well as some desks which are
still free. The floor is carpeted in some places, where students can sit and
read books from the shelves which adorn the room. In the back of the room
there is a stairway leading up, and to the south is the doorway back outside.

Exits.Description: To the south is the exit from the training room to the outdoors.
Stairs lead up to the second floor of the training room.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The books on the shelves are all to big and the words in them are all too
small. You decide it's not worth reading any of them.
The carpet is navy blue, with white floral designs woven into it.

The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style so
that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.
Remarkably, it looks just like a door.
Stairs lead up to the second floor of the training room.

rooms.Name: The upper floor of Baron's training room
rooms.Description:
The training room meets the standard requirements for a place of learning set
long ago. Most training rooms the world over look identical on the inside.
This floor is set up similar to the floor below. The teacher stands behind an
L-shaped desk in the north end of the room, instructing the class. The
students all have small desks of their own; some are still empty. There are
various chairs and tables here, but unlike downstairs, there are no carpets or
shelves. In the back of the room there is a stairway leading down.

Exits.Description: Stairs lead down to the first floor of the training room.

ExtraDescs.Description: The walls are made of a very clean white stone which has been cut into bricks.

The furniture is made of a softwood material and crafted assembly-line style so
that each piece appears almost identical to others of its type.
Stairs lead down to the first floor of the training room.
